hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition Mean Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC transitions from high volatility (>80% annualized) to moderate volatility (<50% annualized) regime within 3 days, implied volatility (Deribit BTC DVOL) will overshoot the decline and revert toward the new realized volatility level within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Implied volatility tends to exhibit persistence bias after stress events, declining slower than realized volatility. This creates pricing inefficiencies in volatility derivatives that correct as markets normalize.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day annualized realized volatility drops from >80% to <50% within 3 days
BTC DVOL (1-month implied vol) remains >15% above new realized volatility level
BTC price stabilizes (daily returns <2% absolute) for 2 consecutive days post-transition

exit_conditions.take_profit: DVOL converges to within 5% of realized volatility OR 5 trading days elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price experiences >4% single-day move in either direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: DVOL continues diverging from realized volatility (>20% gap persists) in >35% of regime transitions, indicating structural change in volatility pricing.
